Challenge Proposal

Purpose

The app I am building will make monsters with different silly faces. When the user completes a monster, it will make a funny noise and print a fun fact about the monster. The game will function like the old fashioned Mr. Potato head where the user will be able to place facial features on the monster.

This app serves three purposes: The first is to deepen my understanding of the things that I have learned in class this semester; the second is to prove to my teacher that I have mastered the concepts from class, and the third is its actual functionality. I've decided that creating a fun, artsy app for kids will fulfill all the requirements and be a fulfilling project to spend a lot of time on.

Audience

This app will be fun for younger children to use. I think it will be ideal for kids ages 4-6 but some slightly older kids, and 6-10 my find it entertaining for a short time.

Data sources

  • localStorage

    I am going to save the different monster choices to local storage and return the completed monster from a local JSON file

  • local JSON file

    I plan to make a local JSON file that has all of the monster information in it. It will reference an SVG file and either an audio element or a text string to go with each picture.

Initial Module list

  • main.js

  • monster.js

  • local_storage.js

Wireframes

Here is a mockup of the final page with the monster output. The main page will have a similar background with images of different monster bodies, eyes, mouths, and noses to choose from.

Colors/Typography/specific Element styling

Because the audience is small children, the buttons need to be bigger, and the colors need to be brighter.
